Notes:
(Updated: March 15) **Eligibility**: 65+, Agriculture and food services, education and childcare, emergency services. People age 16 to 64 years with certain significant, high-risk medical conditions or disabilities will become eligible for vaccines statewide, to help save the lives of people who are at high-risk of death and severe complications from COVID-19. [State Fact Sheet identifying health conditions](https://www.cdph.ca.gov/Programs/CID/DCDC/Pages/COVID-19/vaccine-high-risk-factsheet.aspx)

**County restrictions**: County Residents and eligible sector residents employed in county.

**Appointment Information**: Persons meeting the current vaccine eligibility criteria should go to [Countyofglenn.net/COVID19](http://countyofglenn.net/COVID19?fbclid=IwAR2bROtZKTF-z38fgNJDxUxPlFqFzEv_hYmPREpAjFBxjSy6z-9O_MCKVFk) to complete Vaccine Interest Survey. 

**Phone numbers:** 530-934-6588 (For those without internet access)

**Additional Info**: Once a resident has completed the online Vaccine Survey of Interest Form, Public Health staff will pull the contact information by batch and complete return calls or emails to schedule an appointment for upcoming clinics.
Información Sobre La Vacuna COVID 19: [Información Sobre La Vacuna COVID 19 | County of Glenn](https://www.countyofglenn.net/dept/health-human-services/public-health/covid-19/informaci%C3%B3n-sobre-la-vacuna-covid-19)

**_Persons registering for an appointment will be required to show identification to prove eligibility at time of vaccine. Persons without documentation of eligibility at time of appointment will be turned away._Phase 1A: Employer identification badge, paystub, etc. Phase 1B: Workforce sectors - Employer identification badge, paystub, etc. For those 65 and older: Driver's License, State Identification card, passport, etc. for age and Glenn County residency verification**

(Updated: Mar 15)  **Eligibility**: 65+, or working in Emergency services, Education & Childcare, Restaurants, grocery stores and food banks

**County restrictions:** Must be a Shasta county resident or work in Shasta county.

**Appointment Information**: List of locations taking appointments are on the County site 
<https://www.co.shasta.ca.us/ready/covid-19/vaccinations>

Note: County is still well short of the number of vaccines needed for everyone in Phase 1A and 1B who wants to be vaccinated.

If you don’t see an option that works for you and if you are eligible now, get on the waiting list by clicking on the blue oval on the County site (see above for link) and then Public Health will call or email you to set up an appointment.

**Phone numbers:** Individuals without access to the internet can call the Public Health Services Department at (530) 245-7890.

**Additional Info:**

(Updated: Mar 15) **Eligibility**: C**urrently working through Phase 1A and Phase 1B **of the vaccine distribution plan and those who are 16-64 with [severe health conditions](https://www.cdph.ca.gov/Programs/CID/DCDC/Pages/COVID-19/Provider-Bulletin-2-12-21.aspx), based on vaccine availability. This includes those age 60 and older as well as the education & childcare, foster/resource parents, emergency services, food and agriculture, utilities, and transportation sectors, high-risk congregate settings (shelters, detention facilities), and those who work with the homeless population. 

**County restrictions**: Proof of Tuolumne County residence or employment is required.

**Appointment Information**: Vaccine clinic information and a vaccine interest form for eligible residents can be found here: https://www.tuolumnecounty.ca.gov/1317/COVID-Vaccine

(Updated: Mar 15) **Eligibility**: Vaccinating people 65+, childcare and educators, agriculture and food manufacturing workers, emergency services, and grocery and restaurant workers,  individuals aged 16-64 at the highest risk from COVID-19 as a result of one or more severe health conditions, and individuals who reside in high-risk congregate settings.

**County restrictions**: Vaccine clinics are open to those living in Sonoma County.

**Appointment Information**: A list of vaccination clinics is available here: https://socoemergency.org/emergency/novel-coronavirus/vaccine-information/clinics/

(Updated: March 15) **Eligibility**:65+, Agriculture and food services, education and childcare, emergency services ** Individuals age 16-64 with [qualifying high-risk medical conditions or disabilities](https://www.cdph.ca.gov/Programs/CID/DCDC/Pages/COVID-19/Provider-Bulletin-2-12-21.aspx) are eligible to be vaccinated, though vaccine supply remains limited.**

**County restrictions**:As healthcare providers are providing vaccine in Santa Clara County, some providers have restrictions.

**Appointment Information**:Go to <https://www.sccgov.org/sites/covid19/Pages/COVID19-vaccine-information-for-public.aspx> to see sites where healthcare providers offering vaccine and to make appointments.

**Phone numbers**:(408) 792-5050 Santa Clara Dept of Public Health 

**Additional Info**:Santa Clara County, VTA has created an [interactive map](https://www.vta.org/sites/default/files/2021-02/FINAL%20VaccinationMap-02-23-21b_SHR.pdf) for the public to find a list of the current vaccination locations, along with the bus or light rail routes to take to each site. Transit trips are free as VTA is [currently not collecting fares](https://www.vta.org/blog/service-frequency-improvements-no-fare-collection-effect-feb-8). When viewers click on any vaccination location on the map, they will be taken to the Google Maps transit option to find the most efficient transit route to get to the destination.
Website has information in Spanish, Chinese, Vietnamese, Tagalong

(Updated: Mar 15) **Eligibility**: Age 65+, or those who are 16+ in the following groups: Long-Term Care staff and residents, Medical first responders, Emergency Services, Food & Ag, Educational Institutions, or Licensed Childcare.

As of Mar 15:
Healthcare providers may use their clinical judgement to vaccinate individuals age 16-64 who are deemed to be at the very highest risk for morbidity and mortality from COVID-19 as a direct result of one or more of the following severe health conditions, and individuals in specified settings are eligible to be vaccinated due to increased risk, as specified in this provider bulletin here: [Provider Bulletin (ca.gov)](https://www.cdph.ca.gov/Programs/CID/DCDC/Pages/COVID-19/Provider-Bulletin-2-12-21.aspx)

Individuals with these conditions are strongly encouraged to seek vaccination with a primary health care provider or system, or in an alternate clinical setting. Check first with your usual health care provider.

**County restrictions**: Must be a Madera county resident or work in Madera county

**Appointment Information**: To make an appointment for the FIRST VACCINE, fill out the form at this link: <https://tinyurl.com/j5u6bj89> or to make an appointment for the SECOND VACCINE, fill out the form at this link: <https://tinyurl.com/nca9kufw>

**Phone numbers**: Individuals who have questions can call the county at 3-1-1. To receive text updates, text MADERAVAX to 888777

**Additional Info: **There is also an Overflow list, when appointments are filled. To add your name to the Waitlist, click this link: [Online Survey Software | Qualtrics Survey Solutions](https://qaz1.az1.qualtrics.com/jfe/form/SV_5baCrN1FQJQEoQK)

(Updated: Mar 15) **Eligibility**: Age 65+, or age 18+ AND ALSO work in one of the following groups: Education & Childcare, Food & Agriculture, Emergency Services.

As of Mar 15:
Persons aged 16-64 years with medical conditions will be eligible through their medical doctors. To see qualifying medical conditions, click this link: <https://www.cdph.ca.gov/Programs/CID/DCDC/Pages/COVID-19/ProviderBulletin-2-12-21.aspx>

**County restrictions**: Must be residents of, or work in Yuba-Sutter counties. 

**Appointment Information**: SECOND VACCINE March 17 (if you received the first dose through the county), click on this link: <https://tinyurl.com/skuwh36b> 

**Phone numbers**: To make appointments by phone, calls can only be made to (530) 634-7496 Wednesdays after 9:00 am

**Additional Info**: New Clinic information is released on Wednesdays at 9am. Click on this link to see the clinics, <https://tinyurl.com/mmmmj4fx>

Información en español: <https://tinyurl.com/bfz54743>

(Updated: Mar 16) **Eligibility:** 65+, Education and Childcare, Emergency Services, 16+ with specific high-risk medical conditions or disabilities according to state guidelines: <https://www.cdph.ca.gov/Programs/CID/DCDC/Pages/COVID-19/vaccine-high-risk-factsheet.aspx> 

**County Restrictions:** Must be a resident of Humboldt County.

**Appointment Information:** The county or a local healthcare provider will notify residents when they are eligible and the vaccine is available. County residents can sign up to be notified when a vaccine is available for your tier by filling out the interest form in [English](http://humboldtgov.org/InterestForm) or [Spanish](https://docs.google.com/forms/d/e/1FAIpQLSdkkP56aNbxfW98_FebzcRj9qZV2e64RXPz8W0EDr7xLUZOcw/viewform). For more information about eligibility and appointment scheduling, please click here: <https://humboldtgov.org/CivicAlerts.aspx?AID=3779> 

**Phone Numbers:** Individuals without access to email or the internet can contact the COVID Community Information Line at 707-441-5000 between 8 AM - 5 PM Monday through Friday.

**Additional Info:** Next week the county will begin to send appointment invitations to food and agriculture workers. Contact the COVID Community Information Line at 707-441-5000 or covidinfo@co.humboldt.ca.us. Para información en español: [Información sobre la Vacuna de COVID-19](https://humboldtgov.org/2887/La-Vacuna).

(Updated: Mar 16) **Eligibility:** 65+, Education and Child Care, Emergency Services, and Food/Agriculture.

**County Restrictions:** Must live or work in Monterey County.

**Appointment Information:** Bring an official form of identification to your appointment that shows your name and date of birth, as well as confirmation of your appointment if you have it. For locations and appointment information please click this link on Google Chrome: <https://www.co.monterey.ca.us/government/departments-a-h/health/diseases/2019-novel-coronavirus-covid-19/vaccination-registration>. Eligibility information can also be found in Spanish here: <https://www.co.monterey.ca.us/Home/ShowPublishedImage/33190/637503002081948806> 

**Phone Numbers:** Call the county's COVID-19 Hotline at 831-769-8700 between 8 AM and 5 PM Monday through Friday, or email [covid-19@co.monterey.ca.us](http://covid-19@co.monterey.ca.us).

**Additional Info:** Starting March 17, individuals 16+ who have certain disabilities or health conditions may become eligible for the vaccine, according to state guidelines found here: <https://www.cdph.ca.gov/Programs/CID/DCDC/Pages/COVID-19/Provider-Bulletin-2-12-21.aspx>

(Updated: Mar 15) **Eligibility**: Age 65+, and (as supplies allow) workers in education, childcare, food & agriculture, fire, law enforcement, and emergency services, Transit and transportation workers, Residents and staff of homeless shelters, behavioral health facilities, incarceration/ detention centers and other at risk congregate setting.

Individuals age 16-64 with a medical condition or disability that puts them at high risk for severe sickness and death as defined by the California Department of Public Health (CDPH). Click this link: <https://tinyurl.com/z8exakt8> to see the CDPH prioritization list. 

**County restrictions**: Must be a resident of Santa Cruz. 

**Appointment Information**: Residents of Santa Cruz County, are encouraged to complete the Vaccine Interest Survey at this link: <https://tinyurl.com/2yjcabxm> 

**Phone numbers**: If you are over 65, call the Bridges to Access Vaccination Helpline to get assistance in obtaining the COVID-19
vaccine at (831) 219-8607. Leave a message with your name, phone number, age and zip code and you will  get a call back within 48 hours.

**Additional Info**: Residents interested in vaccines should first contact their medical provider. Vaccines are also available through sites listed on the chart below. Residents should also sign up for MyTurn to be notified once they are eligible, by visiting **[MyTurn.ca.gov](https://myturn.ca.gov/)**. The Public Health Division will distribute vaccine through the counties
**[local vaccine plan](https://www.santacruzhealth.org/Portals/7/pdfs/coronavirus/2020.12.7_FINAL%20C19%20Vax%20Template%20for%20Santa%20Cruz%20County.pdf)**.

For information about registering for an appointment with various health care providers, click this link: <https://tinyurl.com/ync6h3r7>

(Updated: Mar 16) **Eligibility**: 65+, Education and Child Care, Emergency Services, Food/Agriculture, Congregate Living Facilities (including staff, residents, and all persons experiencing homelessness), and Public Transportation (including airport and commercial airline workers - excluding private planes).

**County Restrictions:** Must live or work in Alameda County.

**Appointment Information**: For locations and appointment information please click this link: <https://covid-19.acgov.org/vaccines.page?#eligibility-hcp>. 

**Phone Numbers:** Contact the county public health department at 510-268-2101.

**Additional Info:** Health care providers may use their clinical judgement to vaccinate individuals 16+ who have certain disabilities or health conditions according to the guidelines found here: <https://covid-19.acgov.org/vaccines.page?#pf>. Sign up to be notified when a vaccine is available for you by filling out this form in [English](https://forms.office.com/Pages/ResponsePage.aspx?id=LP_9Mm74o0ukfWpEp_RaZJQMTGauARpLj6XkpVpiJ3FUMUwwTk8yTFNHWDA3UUFGSzE4NlQ4RlNMWi4u), [Spanish](https://forms.office.com/Pages/ResponsePage.aspx?id=LP_9Mm74o0ukfWpEp_RaZJQMTGauARpLj6XkpVpiJ3FUMUVYUTEwU1lPU0VIM1paVzI4RTZaQzQ3Sy4u), or [Chinese](https://forms.office.com/Pages/ResponsePage.aspx?id=LP_9Mm74o0ukfWpEp_RaZJQMTGauARpLj6XkpVpiJ3FUNTRFTlA1Qk9NUjU2VVQwMlJWUjRYOVlDMi4u).

(Updated: Mar 16) **Eligibility**: 65+, Food and Agriculture (including Veterinary Services), Education and Childcare, Emergency Services.

**Appointment Information**: If you are eligible for a vaccine, please check with your Primary Care Physician, Doctor, or Healthcare Provider for vaccination opportunities first. Next, check with the Providers under the "Approved Vaccine Providers in San Joaquin County" and "Upcoming Vaccine Events" sections by clicking this link: <https://sjready.org/events/covid19/vaccines.html>. 

**Phone Numbers**: Contact 211 with any questions.

(Updated: Mar 15) **Eligibility**: 65+, and education, childcare, emergency services and food and agriculture workers. 
Also, people 16-64 with cancer, current with debilitated or immunocompromised state; chronic kidney disease, stage 4 or above; chronic pulmonary disease, oxygen dependent; Down syndrome;| immunocompromised state from solid organ transplant; pregnancy; sickle cell disease; heart conditions, excluding hypertension; severe obesity with a BMI >= 40 kg/m2 | Type 2 diabetes mellitus with hemoglobin A1c level greater than 7.5%
Or: a physical or mental disability that is so severe and high-risk that one of the following applies: 1) a COVID-19 infection is likely to result in severe, life-threatening illness or death; OR 2) acquiring COVID-19 will limit the ability to receive ongoing care or services vital to well-being and survival; OR 3) providing adequate and timely COVID care will be particularly challenging as a result of a disability.

**County restrictions**: Must live or work in Tehama County.

**Appointment Information**: Tehama County uses My Turn, the California Department of Public Health COVID-19 Vaccine scheduling system: <https://myturn.ca.gov>

**Phone numbers**: For assistance in registering with My Turn, dial: (833) 422-4255. To talk to the Tehama County Health Services Agency about topics other than vaccine appointment scheduling, dial: (530) 527-6824.

**Additional information**: You can contact the Tehama County Health Services Agency at: [publichealth@tchsa.net](mailto:publichealth@tchsa.net)

(Updated: Mar 15) **Eligibility**: Age 65+, or those working in Childcare and education. Emergency services, Food and agriculture

As of Mar 15, in addition to the above:
Prioritization for those 16 - 64 years old with specified underlying health conditions or disabilities may have prioritization for vaccinations.

The qualifying conditions are highlighted in the [California Department of Public Health Provider Bulletin](https://www.cdph.ca.gov/Programs/CID/DCDC/Pages/COVID-19/Provider-Bulletin-2-12-21.aspx). If you qualify based on this list, please have your provider or specialist complete and return the [High-Risk Referral Form](http://www.mariposacounty.org/DocumentCenter/View/88110) via:
--email (_[vaccine@mariposacounty.org](mailto:vaccine@mariposacounty.org))_ or 
--delivery to our office at 5362 Lemee Lane, Mariposa, CA 95338 (mailing address P.O. Box 99, Mariposa, CA 95338)
Please mark _"Attention: Mariposa County COVID-19 Vaccine Team"_

**County restrictions**: Must be a resident of Mariposa county

**Appointment Information**: Fill out a form to be placed on the contact list, by clicking on this link: <https://tinyurl.com/33t58bv7> If you have already submitted your contact information and have not been called yet, please dial (209) 966-1133 for a recorded update on where our County currently is in the vaccine administering schedule.

**Phone numbers**: If you do not have access to the internet, please call (209) 259-1332 for assistance

(Updated: March 15) **Eligibility**:65+, Agriculture and food services, education and childcare, emergency services. Healthcare providers and pharmacies are also vaccinating Yolo County residents but may have different eligibility requirements. 
Individuals aged 16-64 who are deemed to be at the very highest risk to get very sick from COVID-19 will be eligible. Please see [CDHP Provider bulletin](https://www.cdph.ca.gov/Programs/CID/DCDC/Pages/COVID-19/Provider-Bulletin-2-12-21.aspx).Verification of your diagnosis or disability is not required but you will be asked to self-attest in writing or verbally that you meet [this criteria from the State.](https://www.cdph.ca.gov/Programs/CID/DCDC/Pages/COVID-19/Provider-Bulletin-2-12-21.aspx)  Also,  Public transit and Airport Workers for Commercial Airlines
**County restrictions**:Live or work in Yolo.

**Appointment Information**:Check for available clinics at https://www.yolocounty.org/coronavirus-vaccine 

**Phone numbers**:(833) 965-6268.

**Additional Info**:If you need a ride to a clinic.[Yolobus is offering free rides](https://www.yolobus.com/news/index.php/684) to Yolo County residents on their vaccine appointment days.
If you are homebound and need an in-home vaccine, call 211 or their toll free number: (855) 866-1783.
Yolo County's Facebook page has COVID briefings twice a week Mondays and Thursdays at 10am at <https://www.facebook.com/YoloCounty/> with the latest county information.
 Beginning March 15 Individuals aged 16-64 who are deemed to be at the very highest risk to get very sick from COVID-19 will be eligible. Please see [CDHP Provider bulletin](https://www.cdph.ca.gov/Programs/CID/DCDC/Pages/COVID-19/Provider-Bulletin-2-12-21.aspx).Verification of your diagnosis or disability is not required but you will be asked to self-attest in writing or verbally that you meet [this criteria from the State.](https://www.cdph.ca.gov/Programs/CID/DCDC/Pages/COVID-19/Provider-Bulletin-2-12-21.aspx)  Also beginning March 15, Public transit and Airport Workers for Commercial Airlines

(Updated: Mar 15) **Eligibility:** 65+, 16-64 who is at [highest risk of serious COVID-19 illness or death due to severe health conditions](https://www.recoverslo.org/en/when-and-where-can-you-get-vaccinated.aspx#Residents-at-High-Risk-Because-of-Medical-Conditions-or-Disabilities), Education & Childcare, Emergency services, Food & Agriculture workers

**County restrictions:** Must be a SLO county resident or work in SLO county

**Appointment Information:**
Visit this page to make an appointment:
<https://www.recoverslo.org/en/when-and-where-can-you-get-vaccinated.aspx> 

**Phone numbers:** Public Health Information Line at (805) 788-2903

**Additional Info:** Specific signup details for Essential workers (including Emergency services & Food and Agriculture) can be found on the County site.
<https://www.recoverslo.org/en/when-and-where-can-you-get-vaccinated.aspx>

Note: Residents with high-risk medical conditions or disabilities will be required to truthfully self-attest to their eligibility by having **[a high-risk medical condition as defined by the California Department of Public Health](https://www.cdph.ca.gov/Programs/CID/DCDC/Pages/COVID-19/Provider-Bulletin-2-12-21.aspx)**.

(Updated: Mar 15) **Eligibility**: Vaccinating people 65+, and people working in essential emergency services, education and childcare, and food and agriculture,** **public works, public utilities and public transportation, disaster service workers, and persons with at-risk health conditions, and residents 16-64 with severe health conditions. A complete list of qualifying health conditions is available [at this link](https://www.cdph.ca.gov/Programs/CID/DCDC/Pages/COVID-19/Provider-Bulletin-2-12-21.aspx?fbclid=IwAR3BIlD4fN9-2fAFaFolpwAXP6RTRBNhfhADv3A8BXt6oUpC3B-AkvJ3W7A).

**Appointment Information**: Appointment information can be found here: https://www.buttecounty.net/ph/COVID19/vaccine

**Phone numbers**: For residents without internet, you may call the Vaccine Scheduling Hotline at 530-552-3020 for assistance – please reserve this line for those without internet. Calling the hotline will not book your appointment faster.

**Additional Info:** Transportation is available to vaccination sites through the B-Line’s Paratransit service for persons 70 and older. An application must be completed in advance of the first ride. Applications can be requested over the phone at 530-809-4614, or downloaded at [tinyurl.com/ButteParatransit](http://tinyurl.com/ButteParatransit). A one-way ride on the Paratransit is $3.50.

(Updated: Mar 15) **Eligibility**: People 65+, as well as teachers and child care providers, first responders, food and agricultural workers, individuals experiencing homelessness, and inmates in county jails. 

**Appointment Information**: Information about vaccine appointments can be found here: https://www.smchealth.org/covid-19-vaccination

**Additional Info: **SamTrans will provide free bus rides on existing service to COVID-19 vaccination sites for people living or working within San Mateo County. [Read more here](https://www.samtrans.com/about/MediaRelations/news/SamTrans_to_Provide_Free_Rides_to_Vaccination_Sites_in_San_Mateo_County.html).

(Updated: Mar 15) **Eligibility**: Age 65+, or ages 18+ AND ALSO work in one of the following groups: Education & Childcare, Food & Agriculture, Emergency Services.

As of Mar 15:
Persons aged 16-64 years with medical conditions will be eligible through their medical doctors. To see qualifying medical conditions, click this link: <https://www.cdph.ca.gov/Programs/CID/DCDC/Pages/COVID-19/ProviderBulletin-2-12-21.aspx>

**County restrictions**: Must be residents of, or work in Yuba-Sutter counties. 

**Appointment Information**: To make an appointment for the FIRST or SECOND VACCINE, click on this link:  <https://tinyurl.com/5ban9u3s> New
Clinic information is released on Wednesdays at 9am.

**Phone numbers**: To make appointments by phone calls can only be made to (530) 822-5985 between the hours of 9 am-4 pm M-F

**Additional Info**: SECOND DOSE County Clinic On March 17 at Yuba-Sutter Fairgrounds (if you received the first dose through the county). To register, click on this link: <https://tinyurl.com/y4r7prpw>

If there are no more appointments available, consider signing up to be wait-listed in the event the clinic has "no shows" or cancellations. The waitlist DOES NOT GUARANTEE you a spot for an appointment for the clinic. In the event you do not get called, please register for our next county clinic.

Información en español: <https://tinyurl.com/ysyss4mw>

(Updated: Mar 15) **Eligibility**: Individuals 50-64 years of age, and/or; education and childcare workers; emergency services (non-medical first responders: law enforcement and fire); food and agriculture (grocery stores, restaurant workers, etc.)

People 16-49 years of age and have an underlying health condition or disability which increases their risk of severe COVID-19, and/or:

Those at risk of exposure at work in the following sectors: 
Transportation and logistics; industrial, commercial, residential and sheltering facilities and services; congregate settings with outbreak risk (homeless/unhoused, incarcerated individuals, jails and prisons.

Those at risk of exposure at work in the following sectors:
Water and wastewater; defense; energy; chemical and hazardous materials; communications and IT; financial services; government operations / community-based essential functions. 

**County restrictions**: Must live or work in Mono County.

**Appointment Information**: Vaccination pre-registration required via this form: <https://webapps.mono.ca.gov/covid19/vaccinate-mono-form/> . You will be contacted by the Public Health Department to register for your vaccination appointment. 

**Phone numbers**: Individuals without access to the internet can call (760) 924-1830 for assistance in the pre-registration process.

**Additional information**: Second homeowners are not eligible to receive the vaccine in Mono County. Acceptable proofs of permanent residency can be found here: <https://coronavirus.monocounty.ca.gov/pages/vaccinations/#eligibility>

(Updated: Mar 15) **Eligibility**: 65+, or education, childcare, emergency services, transit and food/restaurant/agriculture workers. 
Also now eligible: 
Those with certain health conditions, disabilities, illness, and living spaces or work environments that put them at higher risk for serious COVID-19 illness (this includes individuals who live or work in a congregate residential setting, such as an incarceration/ detention facility, homeless shelter, or behavioral health facility), people experiencing homelessness, who may transition into congregate settings at short notice, and public transit workers, including airport workers for commercial airlines (but not private airplanes). [More information here](https://sf.gov/information/other-conditions-eligible-covid-19-vaccine).

**County restrictions**: Vaccinations are free for people who live or work in San Francisco

**Appointment Information**: The page includes appointments for county and private-provider sites: https://sf.gov/get-vaccinated-against-covid-19

**Phone number**: For those who don't have internet access or have difficulty using websites, San Francisco recommends calling the state's MyTurn appointment system: (833) 422-4255.

(Updated: Mar 15)  **Eligibility:** 65+, or in Emergency services, Education & Childcare, and Food and Agriculture workers

County expects on March 15 to start vaccinating the following categories (but not confirmed yet): [People at Higher Risk](https://www.cdph.ca.gov/Programs/CID/DCDC/Pages/COVID-19/Provider-Bulletin-2-12-21.aspx)
- People with high-risk health conditions, disabilities, or illness
- People who live or work in congregate living spaces
- People who work in transportation and logistics, including public transit workers and airport workers for commercial airlines (but not private airplanes)

**County restrictions:** Must be a Contra Costa county resident or work in Contra Costa county

**Appointment Information:**
Each eligible group has specific signup links on the website. See <https://www.coronavirus.cchealth.org/get-vaccinated>

**Phone numbers:** Individuals without access to the internet can call the Public Health Services Department at 1-833-829-2626.

**Additional Info: **County recommends that if you're an educator or school personnel looking to get your COVID-19 vaccine, you should try contacting Kaiser to make an appointment: [https://k-p.li/3qKCc3K](https://t.co/PcJfZRCzXA?amp=1)

(Updated Mar 15) **Eligibility**: 65+, or Non-medical first responders, Teachers and Childcare workers, and Food and Agriculture workers.

**County restrictions**: Must be an Inyo county resident

**Appointment Information**: If you believe you are eligible, please fill out this form: <https://docs.google.com/forms/d/e/1FAIpQLSfxml4iOjuCy2dwsppYDHK-bpCbZA2uU0lM699zlVtllE7o5Q/viewform> 

**Additional Information: **Beginning March 15, individuals age 16-64 with certain severe health conditions will be eligible to receive COVID-19 vaccine.

(Updated: Mar 15) **Eligibility**: 65+, or employed in education, emergency services, childcare, or food and agriculture. Also people living or working in homeless shelters or congregate behavioral health settings; people experiencing homelessness.
Also: People 16-64 with high-risk medical conditions including but not limited to: cancer, chronic kidney disease, chronic pulmonary disease, down syndrome, immunocompromised state, pregnancy, sickle-cell disease, heart conditions (excludes hypertension), severe obesity, type II diabetes; individuals with a developmental or severe high-risk disability that puts them at risk for severe illness or interferes with their ability to receive effective treatment for COVID-19.

**County restrictions**: Must live or work in Kings County

**Appointment Information**: Complete the eligibility and appointment form at: <https://bookkcdphvax.timetap.com/#/>

**Phone number**: For those without internet access, call Kings County Dept. of Public Health: (559) 584-1401

(Updated: Mar 15) **Eligibility**: Nevada County is currently focusing on vaccination of people 65+ in 1B countywide, as well as those working in education & childcare, emergency services and food/agriculture, and people with health conditions that put you at the highest risk for extreme complications from COVID-19. [More details here](https://www.mynevadacounty.com/CivicAlerts.aspx?AID=3686).

**Appointment Information**: Public Health is releasing appointments every Friday at noon on [MyTurn.ca.gov](http://myturn.ca.gov/) for appointments at the Whispering Pines Grass Valley vaccine clinic. 

**Additional Info**: A standby list is available for those working in Education and childcare, Emergency services. and Food and Agriculture. This list is for same-day appointments at our Grass Valley clinic to ensure that no dose is wasted. Information about the standby list is available here: <https://www.mynevadacounty.com/CivicAlerts.aspx?AID=3632>
 
To protect confidentiality, verification documentation of the diagnosis or type of disability is not required but instead anyone meeting the eligibility requirements will be asked to sign a self-attestation that they meet the criteria for high-risk medical conditions or disabilities.

(Updated: Mar 15) **Eligibility**: LA County Residents 65 and Older; and people working in Education and Childcare; Emergency Services; Food and Agriculture; Janitorial, Custodial, and Maintenance Services; Transportation and Logistics; people who live or work in congregate living spaces; and people with any health conditions and disabilities [listed here](http://publichealth.lacounty.gov/acd/ncorona2019/vaccine/hcwsignup/?level_1=step-1-eligibility&level_2=elig-health-conditions).

**Appointment Information**: Information to sign up for an appointment can be found here: http://publichealth.lacounty.gov/acd/ncorona2019/vaccine/hcwsignup/ 

**Phone numbers**: Residents with disabilities or without computer access can call [833-540-0473](tel:1-833-540-0473) between 8:00 am and 8:30 pm 7 days a week for assistance with appointments.

(Updated: March 15)**Eligibility**: 65+, Health care workers, Essential workers and others age 16-64 with certain chronic health care conditions (see Press Release 2-08-21) 

**County restrictions**:Eligible residents of Trinity County, or neighboring counties if employed in Trinity County 

**Appointment Information**:https://www.trinitycounty.org/COVID19-Vaccine

**Phone numbers**: 530-623-8235

**Additional Info**: Based on Website information from press releases in February. For latest press releases visit: <https://www.trinitycounty.org/COVID-19/Press-Releases>

TRINITY COUNTY –Trinity County Public Health Branch (TCPHB) will conduct two (2) COVID-19 Mass Vaccination Point of Distribution Sites (PODSs) on Friday March 19, 2021 and Saturday March 20, 2021 located at the Veterans Memorial Hall, 109 Memorial Drive, Weaverville. 
Registration for the TCPHB PODS will open on Tuesday afternoon March 16, 2021.  Register at https://myturn.ca.gov/ or call the CA COVID-19 Hotline at 1-833-422-4255 (M-F 8AM-8PM, Saturday -Sunday 8AM-5PM) for assistance.

(Updated: Mar 15) **Eligibility**: 65+, or Education, Food Service, Grocery and Agriculture Workers, Child Care Providers, and Emergency Services, and persons ages 16-64 who have underlying medical conditions as outlined by the State.

**County restrictions**: Must be an Orange county resident or work in Orange county

**Appointment Information**: You can register to receive a vaccine by clicking this link: [www.Othena.com](https://www.othena.com/) 

**Additional Info**: Other languages available at: <https://occovid19.ochealthinfo.com/covid-19-vaccine-resources> 
Individuals who lack access to technology can call the HCA hotline at (714) 834-2000 for assistance with Othena registration and support. Individuals with medical conditions that make them eligible to receive the vaccine will need to "self attest" that they have one of the identified conditions when scheduling an appointment through Othena.

(Updated: Mar 15)  **Eligibility:** 65+, or 16+ who work in Emergency services, Education & Childcare, and Food and Agriculture workers

Note: 16 &17 year olds who work in these sectors are only eligible to receive the Pfizer vaccine.

As of Mar 15, vaccination will be made available to those with certain health conditions, disabilities, illness, living spaces, or work environments that put them at higher risk for serious COVID-19 illness as [per CDC guidance](https://www.cdph.ca.gov/Programs/CID/DCDC/Pages/COVID-19/Provider-Bulletin-2-12-21.aspx)

**County restrictions:** Must be a Stanislaus county resident or work in Stanislaus county

**Appointment Information:**
The county has details on clinics (mostly first-come, first-served, ie no appointments needed) on their website at <http://schsa.org/coronavirus/vaccine/>

**Phone numbers:** Public Information line at (209) 558-7535

**Additional Info:** County site updated every Friday or as vaccine availability changes.

According to the county, vaccination screening forms will be provided at the clinics. If you wish to fill out your screening prior to arriving at the clinic, the form is available for you to print at <http://schsa.org/coronavirus/vaccine/pdf/covid-vaccine-screening.pdf>

(Updated: Mar 15) **Eligibility**: Sacramento County residents who are 65+, as well as people who live or work in Sacramento County who are Education or childcare workers, Food service workers, Agricultural, farm or ranch workers, Emergency Services personnel, licensed caregivers, those living in high-risk congregate settings, and people 16-64 with high-risk medical conditions.

**Appointment Information**: Some sites in the county are only for residents 65+. Please see <https://www.saccounty.net/COVID-19/Pages/CoronavirusVaccine.aspx> for more information.

**Phone numbers**: SCPH COVID-19 Hotline is available for vaccination questions: 916-875-2400

**Additional Info**: SacRT offers free rides to vaccination appointments: https://www.sacrt.com/apps/your-free-ride-to-receive-the-covid-19-vaccine/

(Updated: March 15)**Eligibility**:65+, Agriculture and food services, education and childcare, emergency services 

**County restrictions**:You must live or work in San Benito County to be eligible. 

**Appointment Information**:You can submit the online form so you can be added to the contact list: [click here](https://hhsa.cosb.us/vaccine-registration-portal/). 

**Phone numbers**: Public Health Hotline  831-636-4113

**Additional Info**:Filling out online form will put you on the contact list for vaccines. This is NOT scheduling your vaccine appointment. The county will then contact you about scheduling an appointment when eligible and vaccine available. 

###

Updated: Mar 16) **Eligibility**: 65+, or education, childcare, food service, agriculture, and emergency services. Also: Age 16-64 with severe, high-risk medical conditions; age 16-64 with significant, high-risk disabilities; people working in transportation and logistics; people working or living in congregate living space. [For more details](https://coronavirus.marinhhs.org/vaccine/distribution)

**County restrictions**: Must live in Marin County.

**Appointment Information**: Complete the vaccination interest form: <https://marincountyhc.jotform.com/210187732830049>
 
**Phone number**: County residents who cannot make appointments via the internet can call (833) 641-1988 to get live help, Mon-Fri, 8 am to 5 pm.

**Additional information:** New appointments are opened on Friday afternoons.  The county asks that you not call or email Marin Public Health to make an appointment. 
Free public transit is offered by Sonoma-Marin Area Rail Transit for vaccine appointment holders to either the Civic Center or Larkspur train stations. Marin Transit will offer a free shuttle to/from the train station to the nearby vaccine sites.

(Updated: Mar 16) **Eligibility:** 65+, Education and Childcare, Emergency Services, Food and Agriculture, individuals 16-64 who have certain disabilities or health conditions, incarcerated, homeless, Transportation and Logistics according to state guidelines found here: <https://www.cdph.ca.gov/Programs/CID/DCDC/Pages/COVID-19/Provider-Bulletin-2-12-21.aspx>

**County Restrictions:** Must live or work in Lake County.

**Appointment Information:** Individuals will need to show ID and proof of residence at the time of the appointment, as well as proof of eligibility if applicable (or fill out the self-attestation form found here: <http://health.co.lake.ca.us/Assets/Departments/Health/Public+Health+Division/COVID-19/Vaccines/3.15.21+COVID+Vaccine+Self-Attestation+form.pdf>). Eligible workers must additionally show proof of employment. For locations and appointment information please click this link: <http://health.co.lake.ca.us/Coronavirus/Vaccines.htm> 

**Phone Numbers:** County residents 65+, who do not have the ability to schedule online, can call 707-993-4644 for assistance. County farmworkers can call 707-262-4162, 707-262-4153 or 707-262-4159, Monday - Friday, 9-5 for assistance. Please do not call these numbers if appointments are filled. If you have questions about the vaccine, call 211 or 707-263-8174, or text "covid19" to 211-211.

**Additional Info:** New links to schedule first dose appointments are posted every few days on the county website. You may also contact your medical provider to inquire about vaccine appointments.

(Updated: March 15) **Eligibility**:65+, Agriculture and food services, education and childcare, emergency service
Individuals aged 16-64 who are deemed to be at the very highest risk to get very sick from COVID-19 will be eligible. Please see [CDHP Provider bulletin](https://www.cdph.ca.gov/Programs/CID/DCDC/Pages/COVID-19/Provider-Bulletin-2-12-21.aspx).
**County restrictions**:Live or work in Ventura County

**Appointment Information**:Appointment registration at https://www.venturacountyrecovers.org/vaccine-information/

**Phone numbers**:805-477-7161(for those with limited internet access) 

**Additional Info**:Appointments open on Monday mornings at 7 am online and at 8 am on the phoneline . Appointments also open throughout the week from cancellations and/or additional allocations from the state.
The Area Agency on Aging provides transportation services for older adults that are in need of transportation to a vaccine appointment or for COVID-19 testing. This includes people that need lift assist as well as gurney transportation. The driver will take the individual, wait for them, help them at the site and take them home. To schedule a ride call 805-477-7300

(Updated: Mar 15)  **Eligibility:** 65+, or in Emergency services, Education & Childcare, Food and agriculture, Transportation and logistics, industrial, commercial, residential, and sheltering facilities and services, critical manufacturing. Congregate settings with outbreak risk: Incarcerated, Homeless 

**County restrictions:** Must be a Calaveras county resident or work in Calaveras county

**Appointment Information:** Persons 65 and older interested in getting the COVID-19 vaccine, you can schedule online at this link: **[https://myturn.ca.gov](https://myturn.ca.gov/?fbclid=IwAR05FFeC0O-dTtESyEd3Wq5csdmGwgMjm3DwRSp_ffth5cVaXUWDax9eVUg)** or you can call 1-833-422-4255 to schedule an appointment. 

**Phone numbers:** Individuals without access to the internet can call Call (209) 754-2564 and provide your full name, date of birth, and a phone number to best reach you. Also, COVID Community Call Center 
(209) 754-2896

**Additional Info:** If you are not currently eligible, Calaveras Public Health will notify the public through local media outlets and social media when it's your turn.

(Updated: Mar 15)  **Eligibility:** 65+, or in Emergency services, Education & Childcare, and Food and Agriculture workers, as well as 16+ with high-risk conditions as [per the County guidelines](https://covid19.tularecounty.ca.gov/covid-19-vaccine/vaccine-plan-distribution-in-tulare-county/)

**County restrictions:** Must be a Tulare county resident or work in Tulare county.

**Appointment Information:**
To view locations where the vaccine is available and register for an appointment if in an eligible group, go here: 
[COVID-19 Vaccine - COVID 19 (ca.gov)](https://covid19.tularecounty.ca.gov/covid-19-vaccine/)

To be notified when you are eligible to receive your vaccine, and to register, sign up here: 
[My Turn - California COVID-19 Vaccine Scheduling & Notifications](https://myturn.ca.gov/)  

In addition, there is a complete list of local healthcare providers currently offering COVID vaccinations on the County webpage here:
<https://covid19.tularecounty.ca.gov/covid-19-vaccine/make-a-vaccination-appointment/covid-vaccination-sites-in-tulare-county/>

**Phone numbers:** Individuals without access to the internet can call the MyTurn Hotline at 1-833-422-4255 to make an appointment.

**Additional Info: **Tulare County residents and workers who are currently eligible to receive the COVID-19 vaccine and have been unable to secure an appointment elsewhere can now get vaccinated at clinics located at the Lindsay Wellness Center and Earlimart Memorial Building. Visit My Turn at: <https://myturn.ca.gov/> to sign up, or call 1-833-422-4255 if in need of assistance over the phone.

(Updated: Mar 16) **Eligibility:** 65+, Education and Childcare, Food and Agriculture, Emergency Services.

**Appointment Information:** Appointments are required to receive the vaccine. If you are eligible, please contact your healthcare provider to find out how they plan to notify you when the vaccine is available for you. For more information, please click this link: <https://www.covid19.dnco.org/vaccines> 

**Phone Numbers**: Contact the county's COVID-19 information line at 707-464-0911. 

**Additional Info:** Health care providers may use their clinical judgement to vaccinate individuals 16+ who have certain disabilities or health conditions, live or work in congregate settings including incarcerated or homeless, or are public transit/airport workers may become eligible for the vaccine, according to the state guidelines found here: <https://www.cdph.ca.gov/Programs/CID/DCDC/Pages/COVID-19/Provider-Bulletin-2-12-21.aspx>. Questions about the vaccine can be submitted using this link: <https://docs.google.com/forms/d/e/1FAIpQLSdArje_nfqiqKSTGmeGcWDjJxbUDaopvLMWwGXlD-UA13wtGA/viewform>

(Updated: March 15)**Eligibility**:Individuals 65 and older (priority given to 75+) and the following sector populations,  Agriculture and food, Education and childcare, Emergency services. Vaccination is now available to those age 16-64 with certain significant, high-risk medical conditions, disabilities, illness, living spaces, or work environments that put them at higher risk for serious COVID-19 illness.
Individuals with these conditions are strongly encouraged to seek vaccination with a primary health care provider or system, or in an alternate clinical setting. Check first with your usual health care provider.

**County restrictions**:Napa County's vaccination efforts are available for those who either live or work in Napa County 

**Appointment Information**:<https://www.countyofnapa.org/3096/COVID-19-Vaccines>

**Phone numbers:** [(707) 253-4270](https://www.google.com/search?client=safari&rls=en&q=Napa+County+department+of+public+health&ie=UTF-8&oe=UTF-8#) Napa County Public Health

**Additional Info**:Website also in Spanish
Registration Information.
[The State of California’s MyTurn website](https://myturn.ca.gov/), which will become the primary registration site for vaccination scheduling statewide in the coming weeks. Check if you’re eligible for vaccination, sign up for notifications, and schedule appointments in select areas.
[Kaiser Permanente](https://mydoctor.kaiserpermanente.org/covid-19/covid-19-vaccine) has a COVID-19 vaccine webpage for members to check their vaccine status online.
[Rite Aid's](https://www.riteaid.com/pharmacy/covid-qualifier) COVID-19 Vaccine Scheduler
[St. Joseph Health](https://coronavirus.providence.org/blog/uf/646123480) outlines how they're reaching out to eligible patients.
[Sutter Health's vaccine resource page](https://www.sutterhealth.org/for-patients/health-alerts/covid-19-vaccine) has ways to check eligibility and schedule appointments.

(Updated: Mar 15) **Eligibility**: Currently vaccinating the following groups: People aged 65 and older; Education, childcare, emergency services and food/agriculture workers; and Persons 16-64 with [certain high-risk medical conditions](https://www.cdph.ca.gov/Programs/CID/DCDC/Pages/COVID-19/Provider-Bulletin-2-12-21.aspx).

(Updated: Mar 15) **Eligibility**: Vaccinating people 65+, and those who work in law enforcement, food and agriculture, education and childcare, postal workers, public transit workers, and those 16-64 with medical conditions that increase covid-19 risk.

**Appointment Information**: Information about how and where to schedule a vaccine appointment can be found here: https://www.countyofcolusa.org/771/COVID19

(Updated: Mar 15) **Eligibility**: 65+, or in Education, Emergency services, Childcare, and Food and Agriculture workers. 
Also, as of Mar 15:
Those with certain health conditions, disabilities, illness, and living spaces or work environments that put them at higher risk for serious COVID-19 illness (this includes individuals who live or work in a congregate residential setting, such as an incarceration/ detention facility, homeless shelter, or behavioral health facility), people experiencing homelessness, who may transition into congregate settings at short notice, and public transit workers, including airport workers for commercial airlines (but not private airplanes),  [More details here](https://kernpublichealth.com/wp-content/uploads/2021/03/NewVaccineEligible-3.12.pdf)

**County restrictions**: Must be a Kern county resident or work in Kern county

**Appointment Information**: For locations and appointment information please click this link: [https://kernpublichealth.com](https://kernpublichealth.com/)

**Phone numbers**: Individuals without access to the internet can call the Public Health Services Department at 661-321-3000

(Updated: Mar 16) **Eligibility:** 65+, Education and Childcare, Emergency Services, Food and Agriculture, Transportation and Logistics, Congregate Living Staff and Residents (including sheltering facilities, behavioral health facilities, incarcerated persons, homeless), and 16+ with high-risk medical conditions according to state guidelines found here: <https://www.cdph.ca.gov/Programs/CID/DCDC/Pages/COVID-19/Provider-Bulletin-2-12-21.aspx>

**County Restrictions: **Must live or work in El Dorado County.

**Appointment Information:** The county directs all residents to contact their primary care provider as their first and best option to receive a vaccine. You may need to provide proof of age, residency, and/or employment status in the county at the time of your appointment. For locations and appointment information please click this link: <https://www.edcgov.us/Government/hhsa/Pages/EDCCOVID-19-clinics.aspx> 

**Phone Numbers:** Seniors 75+ who need extra help scheduling an appointment for the vaccine can call 530-295-4101. Call the county's COVID phone line at 211 or 833-223-9797, or email [EDCCOVID-19@edcgov.us](http://EDCCOVID-19@edcgov.us) 

**Additional Info:** Seniors 75+ can also receive assistance at each of its county libraries, with more information here: <https://www.edcgov.us/Government/hhsa/PublishingImages/pages/EDCCOVID-19-vaccine/COVID19%20Senior%20Services%20VC%20Flyer%202.2.21.pdf>. For those who are not currently eligible to receive a vaccine, you can sign up for notifications about phases/tier changes using this form: <https://forms.gle/J152S7TYTv3pmDu97>. Contact EDCCOVID-19@edcgov.us with any questions.

<https://www.plumascounty.us/2761/COVID-19-Vaccine>

(M-F 8AM-8PM, Sa-Su 8AM-5PM) for assistance with MyTurn.

(Updated: March 15)**Eligibility**: 65+, food and agricultural workers, emergency service workers, education and childcare workers. Healthcare providers may use their clinical judgement to vaccinate individuals age 16-64 who are deemed to be at the very highest risk for morbidity and mortality from COVID-19 as a direct result of several severe health conditions.


**County restrictions**:County Residents and eligible sector residents employed in SBC.

**Appointment Information**:<https://publichealthsbc.org/covid-19-vaccine-appointment-registration/>. 

**Phone numbers**:The county suggests calling 2-1-1 and select option 4, Child care workers information 805-925-7071. 

**Additional Info**: Appointments offered by the Santa Barbara County Public Health Department sites for this sector will be posted on Mondays at 9:00 am.

(Updated: Mar 15) **Eligibility**: Age 65+, or in Education and Childcare, Emergency services, and Food and Agriculture workers.

As of Mar 15:
Healthcare providers may use their clinical judgement to vaccinate individuals age 16-64 who are deemed to be at the very highest risk for morbidity and mortality from COVID-19 as a direct result of one or more of the severe health conditions included in this _[provider bulletin](https://www.cdph.ca.gov/Programs/CID/DCDC/Pages/COVID-19/Provider-Bulletin-2-12-21.aspx)_.

**County restrictions**: Must be a Riverside county resident or work in Riverside county

**Appointment Information**: For FIRST DOSE Vaccine please click on this link:  [COVID-19 Vaccine (rivcoph.org)](https://www.rivcoph.org/COVID-19-Vaccine-with-Registration) or                                                
for a SECOND DOSE appointment, Riverside County health officials will reach out to residents through the contact method provided at the first appointment.

**Phone numbers**: For seniors 65 and older who need assistance, please dial 2-1-1 or (951) 329-4703

**Additional Info**: Residents who received their first dose at a private provider, should contact that same provider to schedule their second dose. 

NOTICE: Residents may now schedule their 2nd dose appointment at any of the RUHS-Public Health Clinics or Curative Clinics.

(Updated: Mar 16) **Eligibility**: 65+, Education & Childcare, Emergency Services, Food & Agriculture, those who are incarcerated (congregate setting), individuals 18+ who have certain disabilities or health conditions as outlined here: <https://publichealth.co.modoc.ca.us/covid-19_information/covid-19_vaccine/index.php>. Additionally foster parents, disaster response workers, and essential workers in Transportation & Logistics, Water & Waste Management, Housing Construction & Finance, Information Technology, Communications, Energy, Law, Media, Public Safety, and Government Operations & Community Services.

**Appointment Information**: To schedule a vaccination appointment or join the waitlist, call the COVID WarmLine at 530-233-1350 or 530-640-3171 between 8 AM and 5 PM Monday - Thursday. For more information, please click this link: <https://publichealth.co.modoc.ca.us/covid-19_information/covid-19_vaccine/index.php> Anyone 16+ is encouraged to call to get on the waitlist.

**Phone Numbers**: Call the county's COVID WarmLine at 530-233-1350 or 530-640-3171 between 8 AM and 5 PM Monday - Thursday with any questions.

**Additional Info**: The county anticipates providing 420 doses during the week of Mar 15-19.

(Updated: Mar 16) **Eligibility**: 65+ Amador residents with chronic health conditions (age 18 & over), health care workers, first responders, educators, community outreach workers, agriculture workers, grocery store workers, restaurant and food service workers, caregivers and childcare providers are also eligible to receive the vaccine at Public Health vaccination clinics.

**Appointment Information**: To see upcoming vaccine clinics run by the county as well as other locations, please click this link: <https://tinyurl.com/drwue7k3> 
County-run vaccine clinics are announced via e-notification as well. To sign up for Amador County e-notification visit the Amador County website: https://www.amadorgov.org/about/e-notifications and choose “Health & Safety” notifications

**Phone numbers**: If you don’t have access to the internet, you can call Amador Dept of Public Health (209) 223-6407

**Additional Info**: Upcoming clinics on Mar 17, 18, and 19. To register for an appointment, click this link: <https://tinyurl.com/drwue7k3>

(Updated: Mar 15)  **Eligibility:** 65+, essential workers, and those 18-
64 with underlying medical conditions.

**County restrictions:** Must be an Alpine county resident (whether full-time resident OR part-time resident & property owner) or work in Alpine county.

**Appointment Information:**
As of Feb 24th, County is requesting anyone 18+ (that is eligible as per the "county restrictions" section above) to call the Warm Line below and register their interest. A list will be complied, and names will be prioritized based on age, underlying medical conditions,
occupation, and residency.

- Woodfords and Bear Valley – call the Warm Line at 530-694-1011
- Washoe Tribal Health Center – call 775-265-8622

**Phone numbers:** Individuals without access to the internet can call the Warm Line at 530-694-1011.

**Additional Info:** <https://alpinecountyca.gov/DocumentCenter/View/4272/ACPHB-vaccine-eligibility-update-22421?bidId=>

(Updated Mar 15) **Eligibility**: 65+, and Education, Childcare, and Food and Agriculture workers, and individuals with high-risk medical conditions.

**County restrictions**: Must be a Fresno county resident or work in Fresno county

**Appointment Information**: Appointments can be booked through MyTurn at <https://myturn.ca.gov> 

**Phone numbers**: Fresno County residents who do not have internet access can call MyTurn at 1-833-422-4255 to sign up for a notification for when it’s their turn to get vaccinated against COVID-19. MyTurn operators speak English and Spanish, with an ability to add a third-party operator in 254 languages. 

**Additional Information**: Those with high-risk medical conditions and unable to visit a medical provider can complete and bring the following form indicating they self-attest to having a medical condition under the [CDPH High-Risk Medical Conditions eligibility criteria](https://www.cdph.ca.gov/Programs/CID/DCDC/Pages/COVID-19/Provider-Bulletin-2-12-21.aspx):
- High-Risk Medical Condition Self Attestation Form ([English](https://www.co.fresno.ca.us/home/showpublisheddocument?id=53028)) ([Spanish](https://www.co.fresno.ca.us/home/showpublisheddocument?id=53030))
